title: Designating the Board of Peace as a Public International Organization Entitled To Enjoy Certain Privileges, Exemptions, and Immunities
summary: Executive Order 14375, issued by the President on January 16, 2026, designates the Board of Peace as a public international organization eligible for privileges, exemptions, and immunities under the International Organizations Immunities Act. This designation does not affect any existing or future legal rights or privileges of the Board of Peace. The order also clarifies that it does not alter executive department authorities, the functions of the Office of Management and Budget, or create new legal rights or benefits. Implementation is subject to applicable law and funding availability, with publication costs covered by the Department of State.
